conversation.content: [formally] 他们告诉我，你在边境独居了12年，拒绝与文明世界有任何接触。[pause] 但你现在站在我的朝堂上，claiming knowledge of treason.
[quietly] 我本来不想来的。
[stern] 但你还是来了，穿过3天的敌对领地才到达我的城门。[curious] 一个隐士不会无缘无故放弃孤独，so tell me what you witnessed.
[hesitantly] 你的北方要塞指挥官，每个月初都会在废弃的磨坊会见外国骑兵。[clearing throat] 我看见过金币易手，castle defenses的地图在灯光下摊开在桌上。
[very quietly] 艾德里克指挥官为王室服务了20年，fought in three wars defending these lands. [pause] 你要我相信，就凭你从树林里瞥见的影子，她就背叛了？
[bitter] 信不信由你，陛下，但我认出了那些外国骑兵的徽章——莫格林军队的黑蛇标志。[sighs] 他们计划在丰收节动手，when your guard is spread thin across the celebrations.
[anxious] 丰收节还有4天，半个王国的人都会在城墙内庆祝。[frustrated] 如果你说的是真的，we're talking about a massacre of innocent families, 孩子们——
[firmly] 这就是我离开树林来这里的唯一原因。[very quietly] 我这辈子见过太多死亡，I know when more is coming, 我不能再坐视不理了。
[empathetically] 你以前是个士兵，对吗？[pause] Before you chose isolation, 在某件事驱使你放弃这个世界，选择与树木和寂静为伴之前。
[shaky voice] 我是你父亲在西堡围城时的禁卫队长，我们守住那座桥7天。[long pause] 我下令让好人去送死，while nobles fled with their gold.
马可斯·索恩队长——我以为你在那场围城中死了。[gasps softly] 我父亲战后到处找你，派骑兵搜遍了整个王国，looking for his most trusted protector.
你父亲知道我活着。[sighs] 他理解为什么我不能回到朝廷，after what I'd done, 在我做出那些可怕的牺牲来拯救王国之后。
[warmly] 他在晚年经常提起你，说你是他认识的唯一真正正直的人。[passionate] 帮我阻止这个阴谋，I'll grant you anything——土地，头衔，足够的金子——
我不要你的赏赐，孩子。[exhales] 我想阻止另一个西堡，another situation where innocent blood soaks into soil, 因为当权者太盲目，看不见背叛就在眼前蔓延。
[frustrated] 那告诉我怎么阻止这一切，without starting a panic, 不要惊动那些阴谋者！[speeding up] 我不能就这样逮捕艾德里克，没有证据，your word alone won't convince my council.
[calmly] 让我带着你最信任的两个人回去，dressed as vagrants not soldiers. [pause] 我们明晚在磨坊等着，your men can witness the treachery with their own eyes.
你愿意在12年的孤独后回来帮我们？[quietly] After everything you've sacrificed, 远离朝廷政治的丑陋和背负他人生命的重担之后？
[regretful] 有些负担，无论你逃到荒野多远都会跟着你。[sighs] 你父亲很久以前救过我的命，long before Westhold, 即使在流放中我也背负着这份债。
[very sincerely] 索恩队长，如果我们活过这一劫，I need someone like you on my council——一个重视真相胜过安逸的人，who's seen the real cost of power, 却仍然选择保护无辜者。
[very quietly] 先专注于活下来吧，陛下，because if I'm right about Aldric's plan, 到这周末，要么阴谋死去，要么你的王国燃烧。[pause] 我见过太多王国燃烧了。

original_conversation.content: [formally] They tell me you've lived alone in the borderlands for twelve years, refusing all contact with civilization. [pause] Yet here you stand in my court, claiming knowledge of treason.
[quietly] Didn't want to come.
[stern] But you did come, traveling three days through hostile territory to reach my gates. [curious] A hermit doesn't abandon solitude without extraordinary cause, so tell me what you witnessed.

[hesitantly] Your northern garrison commander meets with foreign riders every new moon at the abandoned mill. [clearing throat] I've seen gold change hands, maps of the castle's defenses spread on tables by lantern light.

[very quietly] Commander Aldric has served this crown for twenty years, fought in three wars defending these lands. [pause] You're asking me to believe he's turned traitor based on shadows you glimpsed from the woods?

[bitter] Believe what you want, Your Majesty, but I recognized the foreign riders' insignia—the black serpent of Morgrim's army. [sighs] They're planning something for the harvest festival when your guard is spread thin across the celebrations.

[anxious] The harvest festival is in four days, half the kingdom will be within these walls celebrating. [frustrated] If what you're saying is true, we're talking about a massacre of innocent families, children—
[firmly] Which is the only reason I left my woods and came here. [very quietly] I've seen enough death in my lifetime to know when more is coming, and I couldn't sit by watching it unfold again.
[empathetically] You were a soldier once, weren't you? [pause] Before you chose isolation, before whatever drove you to abandon the world and live among trees and silence instead of people.

[shaky voice] I was your father's captain of the guard during the siege of Westhold, where we held the bridge for seven days. [long pause] Where I ordered good men to their deaths while nobles fled with their gold.
Captain Marcus Thorne—I thought you died in that siege. [gasps softly] My father searched for you after the battle, sent riders to every corner of the kingdom looking for his most trusted protector.
Your father knew I survived. [sighs] He understood why I couldn't return to court after what I'd done, after the choices I'd made to save the kingdom at such a terrible cost.

[warmly] He spoke of you often in his final years, said you were the only truly honorable man he'd ever known. [passionate] Help me stop this conspiracy and I'll grant you anything—lands, titles, gold enough to—

I don't want your rewards, boy. [exhales] I want to prevent another Westhold, another situation where innocent blood soaks into soil because those in power were too blind to see betrayal festering in their own ranks.

[frustrated] Then tell me how to stop this without starting a panic or alerting the conspirators that we know their plans! [speeding up] I can't just arrest Aldric without proof, and your word alone won't convince my council.

[calmly] Send me back with two of your most trusted men, dressed as vagrants not soldiers. [pause] We'll wait at the mill during the next meeting, and your men can witness the treachery with their own eyes tomorrow night.
You'd return to help us after twelve years of solitude? [quietly] After everything you've sacrificed to stay away from the ugliness of court politics and the burden of other people's lives?
[regretful] Some burdens follow you no matter how far you run into the wilderness. [sighs] Your father saved my life once, long before Westhold, and I've carried that debt even in my exile.

[very sincerely] Captain Thorne, if we survive this, I need someone like you on my council—someone who values truth over comfort, who's seen the real cost of power and still chooses to protect the innocent.

[very quietly] Let's focus on surviving first, Your Majesty, because if I'm right about Aldric's plan, by week's end either the conspiracy dies or your kingdom burns. [pause] And I've seen too many kingdoms burn.

scenario: A reclusive hermit living in the kingdom's borderlands is brought before the king after discovering evidence of a conspiracy against the crown.
